bit.name: Cortana Hack
bit.tooltip: sort cortana in front of other transparent geometry

bit.name: Use Demo UI
bit.tooltip: uses alternate UI collection for demo

bit.name: Scripted
bit.tooltip: the level script will set this value; the other settings here will be ignored.

bit.name: Invert
bit.tooltip: result of function is one minus actual result

bit.name: Always Active
bit.tooltip: function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound

float32.name: Period
float32.tooltip: this is the period for the above function (lower values make the function oscillate quickly, higher values make it oscillate slowly)

int16.name: Scale Period By Index
int16.tooltip: multiply this function by the above period

int16.name: Scale Function By Index
int16.tooltip: multiply this function by the result of the above function

enum16.name: Wobble Function
enum16.tooltip: the curve used for the wobble

float32.name: Wobble Period
float32.tooltip: the length of time it takes for the magnitude of this function to complete a wobble

float32.name: Wobble Magnitude
float32.tooltip: the amount of random wobble in the magnitude

float32.name: Square Wave Threshold
float32.tooltip: if non-zero, all values above the square wave threshold are snapped to 1.0, and all values below it are snapped to 0.0 to create a square wave.

int16.name: Step Count
int16.tooltip: the number of discrete values to snap to (e.g., a step count of 5 would snap the function to 0.00,0.25,0.50,0.75 or 1.00)

int16.name: Sawtooth Count
int16.tooltip: the number of times this function should repeat (e.g., a sawtooth count of 5 would give the function a value of 1.0 at each of 0.25,0.50,0.75 as well as at 1.0

int16.name: Scale Result By Index
int16.tooltip: multiply this function (from a weapon, vehicle, etc.) final result of all of the above math

enum16.name: Bounds Mode
enum16.tooltip: controls how the bounds, below, are used

int16.name: Turn Off With Index
int16.tooltip: if the specified function is off, so is this function

int16.name: Desired Permutation
int16.tooltip: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

int16.name: Desired Permutation
int16.tooltip: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

int16.name: Desired Permutation
int16.tooltip: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

int8.name: Multiplayer Team Index
int8.tooltip: on a multiplayer map, this determines which team the vehicle belongs to for custom vehicle sets.

bit.name: Slayer Default
bit.tooltip: vehicle will spawn when default vehicle set is used in a slayer game

bit.name: CTF Default
bit.tooltip: vehicle will spawn when default vehicle set is used in a ctf game

bit.name: King Default
bit.tooltip: vehicle will spawn when default vehicle set is used in a king game

bit.name: Oddball Default
bit.tooltip: vehicle will spawn when default vehicle set is used in a oddball game

bit.name: Slayer Allowed
bit.tooltip: vehicle can spawn in a slayer game

bit.name: CTF Allowed
bit.tooltip: vehicle can spawn in a ctf game

bit.name: King Allowed
bit.tooltip: vehicle can spawn in a king game

bit.name: Oddball Allowed
bit.tooltip: vehicle can spawn in a oddball game

int16.name: Desired Permutation
int16.tooltip: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

int16.name: Desired Permutation
int16.tooltip: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

int16.name: Desired Permutation
int16.tooltip: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

int16.name: Desired Permutation
int16.tooltip: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

int16.name: Desired Permutation
int16.tooltip: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

int16.name: Desired Permutation
int16.tooltip: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

int16.name: Primary Rounds Loaded
int16.tooltip: -1 = weapon default

int16.name: Primary Rounds Total
int16.tooltip: -1 = weapon default

int16.name: Secondary Rounds Loaded
int16.tooltip: -1 = weapon default

int16.name: Secondary Rounds Total
int16.tooltip: -1 = weapon default

int16.name: Manual BSP Index
int16.tooltip: structure bsp index that this encounter belongs to... ignored unless 'manual bsp index' flag is checked. if this flag is not checked, the structure bsp is found automatically (may fail in areas of overlapping geometry)

rangef.name: Respawn Delay
rangef.tooltip: delay between respawning actors in this encounter

enum16.name: Initial State
enum16.tooltip: state that this actor starts in

enum16.name: Return State
enum16.tooltip: state that this actor will return to when it has nothing to do

enum16.name: Unique Leader Type
enum16.tooltip: what kind of leader this squad has (e.g. a sarge for marines) - 'normal' is based on the size of the squad, 'random' always creates a leader, or you can specify an individual type

int16.name: Normal Difficulty Count
int16.tooltip: initial number of actors on normal difficulty

int16.name: Insane Difficulty Count
int16.tooltip: initial number of actors on insane difficulty (hard difficulty is midway between normal and insane)

int16.name: Respawn Minimum Actors
int16.tooltip: minimum number of actors alive at once (will spawn instantly if less than this number)

int16.name: Respawn Maximum Actors
int16.tooltip: maximum number of actors alive at once (never spawns above this number)

int16.name: Respawn Total
int16.tooltip: total number to respawn (zero = infinite)

rangef.name: Respawn Delay
rangef.tooltip: delay between respawning actors in this squad

int8.name: Sequence ID
int8.tooltip: identifies this move position as belonging to a sequence, only actors whose starting locations match this sequence ID can use it (zero = no sequence)

int8.name: Sequence ID
int8.tooltip: which move position sequence we can use (zero = no specific sequences)

enum16.name: Return State
enum16.tooltip: state that this actor will return to when it has nothing to do

enum16.name: Initial State
enum16.tooltip: state that this actor starts in

bit.name: Allow Initiative
bit.tooltip: lets an actor decide to stop following its commands and attack an enemy

bit.name: Allow Targeting
bit.tooltip: lets an actor shoot at enemies while following its commands

bit.name: Disable Looking
bit.tooltip: stops an actor from turning, stopping or looking around in response to stimuli received while following its commands

bit.name: Disable Communication
bit.tooltip: stops an actor from communicating while following its commands

bit.name: Disable Falling Damage
bit.tooltip: makes an actor not take any damage from falling while following its commands

bit.name: Manual BSP Index
bit.tooltip: set if the command list is manually attached to a specific bsp

int16.name: Manual BSP Index
int16.tooltip: structure bsp index that this encounter belongs to... ignored unless 'manual bsp index' flag is checked. if this flag is not checked, the structure bsp is found automatically (may fail in areas of overlapping geometry)

tagRef.name: Animation Graph
tagRef.tooltip: leave this blank to use the unit's normal animation graph

bit.name: Stop If Death
bit.tooltip: this conversation will be aborted if any participant dies

bit.name: Stop If Damaged
bit.tooltip: an actor will abort this conversation if they are damaged

bit.name: Stop If Visible Enemy
bit.tooltip: an actor will abort this conversation if they see an enemy

bit.name: Stop If Alerted To Enemy
bit.tooltip: an actor will abort this conversation if they suspect an enemy

bit.name: Player Must Be Visible
bit.tooltip: this conversation cannot take place unless the participants can _see_ a nearby player

bit.name: Stop Other Actions
bit.tooltip: participants stop doing whatever they were doing in order to perform this conversation

bit.name: Keep Trying To Play
bit.tooltip: if this conversation fails initially, it will keep testing to see when it can play

bit.name: Player Must Be Looking
bit.tooltip: this conversation will not start until the player is looking at one of the participants

float32.name: Trigger Distance
float32.tooltip: distance the player must enter before the conversation can trigger

float32.name: Run-To-Player Distance
float32.tooltip: if the 'involves player' flag is set, when triggered the conversation's participant(s) will run to within this distance of the player

bit.name: Optional
bit.tooltip: the conversation can continue even if nobody for this participant was found

bit.name: Has Alternate
bit.tooltip: if nobody for this participant can be found, we use a participant marked as 'is alternate' instead, e.g. someone from over the radio

bit.name: Is Alternate
bit.tooltip: this participant is only used if some participant in this conversation was marked as 'has alternate' could not be found

int16.name: Use This Object Index
int16.tooltip: if a unit with this name exists, we try to pick them to start the conversation

int16.name: Set New Name Index
int16.tooltip: once we pick a unit, we name it this

bit.name: Wait After Until Told To Advance

int16.name: Addressee Participant Index
int16.tooltip: this field is only used if the addressee type is 'participant'
